info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 22 at 12:03PM EDT until April 22 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN PRINCE EDWARD...NORTHWESTERN NOTTOWAY AND SOUTHWESTERN AMELIA COUNTIES... At 1202 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Burkeville, or near Crewe, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... Jetersville around 1215 PM EDT. Amelia Courthouse around 1225 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Prince Edward Station, Twin Lakes State Park, Rodophil, Burkes Tavern, Moran, Paineville, Maplewood, Fergusonville, Jennings Ordinary and Prince Edward Lake. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
